info.title: FHIR Encounter resource API documentation
info.description: Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR, pronounced "Fire") defines a set of "Resources" that represent granular clinical concepts. The resources can be managed in isolation, or aggregated into complex documents. Technically, FHIR is designed for the web; the resources are based on simple XML or JSON structures, with an http-based RESTful protocol where each resource has predictable URL. Where possible, open internet standards are used for data representation.

get.description:
Returns Encounters based on filter criteria OR Provides provision for pagination (stateid, page, page_size, _pretty & _bundletype are query parameters used for Paging).

FHIR documentation for Encounter.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: _content
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's data using a fulltext search

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The resource identity

parameters.name: _language
parameters.description: The resource language

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: Only return resources which were last updated as specified by the given range. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given profile

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given security labels

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given tag

parameters.name: _text
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's narrative using a fulltext search

parameters.name: appointment
parameters.description: The appointment that scheduled this encounter

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: Reason the encounter takes place (resource)

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: A date within the period the Encounter lasted. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: episodeofcare
parameters.description: Episode(s) of care that this encounter should be recorded against

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known

parameters.name: incomingreferral
parameters.description: The ReferralRequest that initiated this encounter

parameters.name: indication
parameters.description: Reason the encounter takes place (resource)

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Length of encounter in days

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location the encounter takes place

parameters.name: location-period
parameters.description: Time period during which the patient was present at the location. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: part-of
parameters.description: Another Encounter this encounter is part of

parameters.name: participant
parameters.description: Persons involved in the encounter other than the patient

parameters.name: participant-type
parameters.description: Role of participant in encounter

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: The patient present at the encounter

parameters.name: practitioner
parameters.description: Persons involved in the encounter other than the patient

parameters.name: procedure
parameters.description: Reason the encounter takes place (resource)

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: Reason the encounter takes place (code)

parameters.name: special-arrangement
parameters.description: Wheelchair, translator, stretcher, etc.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: planned | arrived | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Specific type of encounter

put.description:
The conditional update interaction is used to update an existing Encounter based on some identification criteria, rather than by logical id.

delete.description:
The conditional delete interaction allows a client to delete Encounter/Encounters based on some selection criteria, rather than by a specific logical id.

post.description:
This interaction searches a set of Encounters based on some filter criteria. Search interactions take a series of parameters of name'='value pairs encoded as an application/x-www-form-urlencoded submission for a POST.
